intro: Gustavia theophrasta, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Hawaii, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has palm-like leaves and produces a fleshy, spiny fruit that contains seeds. It thrives in wet, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in coastal areas. Due to its cultural significance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
